business.headline: Gold and silver prices dip slightly after record highs. Should you buy or sell?After touching record highs earlier this week, gold and silver prices cooled off slightly on Thursday as investors booked profits. With both metals still near lifetime peaks, the big question is—should you buy the dip or wait for further correction?

Pharma shares rally after report hints tariff relief for genericsThe Nifty Pharma and Healthcare indices opened strong, gaining 1.14% each, as optimism spread across the market. Almost all major pharmaceutical and healthcare companies traded higher.

Looking to invest? These stocks could be worth your moneyMarket experts suggest that metals, healthcare, banking, and even commodities like silver continue to show strength and could offer attractive short-term opportunities.

TCS Q2 results: From layoffs to muted growth expectations, 8 key things to knowTCS's Q2 results will set the tone for India's $250-billion IT industry, testing its resilience amid layoffs, wage pressures, and AI disruption. It will also reveal whether India's tech titan can still outpace global headwinds.

Lupin share price rises over 3% in early trade. What's driving the rally?At around 9:28 am, shares of Lupin were trading at Rs 1,968.75, up Rs 63.05, or 3.31%, on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). Read to know what's driving the rally in shares of the pharma company.

Sensex, Nifty gain as Q2 earnings remain in focus; pharma stocks gainAt around 9:21 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was trading 92.15 points higher at 81,865.81, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 40 points to 25,086.15. Broader market indices also saw modest gains, indicating a largely positive but measured start to the session.

LG Electronics IPO: Here's how much you can earn per share if you bid todayLG India IPO has received a strong response from investors since opening for subscription on October 7. According to exchange data available till October 8 (Day 2), the issue was subscribed 3.33 times overall.

Tata Capital IPO allotment today: Check status and if bumper listing awaitsTata Capital IPO opened for bidding on October 6 and saw decent interest from institutional investors, while retail participation remained moderate.

How much can you earn if you invest iPhone 17 Pro EMIs in a 36-month SIP?If a buyer converts the iPhone 17 Pro's price into a 36-month EMI plan, it roughly comes to Rs 4,200 per month, which is a decent amount to invest in an SIP.

Tata history: From opium wars to boardroom battles, the making of an Indian empireThe history of Tata Group, caught in a boardroom war, is a remarkable tale of ambition, daring ventures, and resilience. This three-part series will explore how a humble family business evolved into India's largest industrial conglomerate, navigating fortunes made from the opium trade and wartime cotton booms, and the enduring challenges that defined its legacy.

Sebi aims to strengthen markets with easier share lending and borrowing: ReportSebi is holding consultations with market participants to improve the Securities Lending and Borrowing (SLB) mechanism, thereby allowing investors to lend or borrow shares for a fee, helping traders take short positions and aiding in better price discovery.

Sensex, Nifty slip as investors book profits; Titan, IT stocks shineThe S&P BSE Sensex fell over 150 points to close below the 82,000 mark, while the Nifty50 slipped more than 60 points to settle just above 25,000. Broader market indices also ended lower, reflecting heightened volatility throughout the day.

Subscribe or skip: Should you ride the ongoing IPO wave on Dalal Street?The IPO rush is exciting, but are investors chasing glitter or real growth? With many listings already below issue price, will patience and selectivity matter more than speed this year?

IndiGo fined Rs 20 lakh by aviation regulator for pilot simulator training lapseThe penalty, imposed on September 26, pertains to the use of non-qualified simulators for training pilots operating at high-risk airports such as Calicut, Leh, and Kathmandu.

Tata Group rift: Which trustees are at the heart of the recent tussle for control?With Home Minister Amit Shah and Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman stepping in to mediate, all eyes are on the people behind the row. Who are these four trustees challenging Noel Tata's leadership, and how did their differences push one of India's most trusted business families into rare public turbulence?

Are real estate stocks a good bet right now? Experts answerGaurang Shah of Geojit Financial Services, the real estate sector has seen a visible turnaround in the last few years, with developers showing financial discipline and faster project execution. However, he added a word of caution for investors.

How Rs 80K grew to Rs 1.9 lakh savings through simple habits, expert explainsYou don't always need a higher salary to grow your wealth. According to an expert, small, intentional changes in spending and saving helped a client turn his Rs 80,000 salary into Rs 1.9 lakh savings in half a year.

Government urges Tata Group to resolve dispute and restore stability: ReportThe government has urged the Tata Group to restore stability in Tata Trusts following internal disputes that risk affecting Tata Sons, India's largest conglomerate, according to The Economic Times. The conflict involves four trustees within Tata Trusts, who are said to have acted as a "super board," challenging Chairman Noel Tata's authority.

Tata Capital's $1.75 billion IPO fully subscribed after strong institutional backingTata Capital has successfully completed its $1.75 billion IPO, fully subscribed thanks to robust demand from qualified institutional buyers, setting the stage for its stock market debut on October 13.

Another boardroom battle at Tata Group?The current crisis arises from a power tussle within Tata Trusts, the philanthropic arm that holds a controlling stake in Tata Sons, the holding company that runs the operations of the Tata Group.

entertainment.headline: Karan Johar chooses profit over passion after Homebound failure, calls it upsetting Karan Johar reflected on focusing on profitable cinema after selling 50 per cent of Dharma Productions. The filmmaker discussed challenges faced by critically acclaimed but unprofitable films like 'Homebound'. Johar confirmed the company's stability and continued control after the deal with Adar Poonawalla.

Kantara actors Rishab Shetty and Jayaram's bromance in New Delhi wins hearts Actors Rishab Shetty and Jayaram had a special reunion in New Delhi following 'Kantara: Chapter 1's' success. The actors' reunion garnered attention and praise from fans.

Diane Warren on how she co-wrote DRAMA for G-Dragon of BIGBANG Diane Warren teamed up with K-pop superstar G-Dragon for his comeback track 'DRAMA'. She emphasised human emotion in music, rejecting AI songwriting despite industry trends.

Rajvir Jawanda's final journey: Funeral to take place in Ludhiana, shares Ammy Virk Punjabi singer Rajvir Jawanda died in Mohali following a road accident. The singer was kept on life support for 11 days before succumbing to injuries. His funeral is scheduled for today in Pona, Jagraon.

Gauahar Khan shares note on motherhood after Ismail Darbar comments on her career Gauahar Khan shared a post about raising boys after her father-in-law Ismail Darbar publicly stated he does not support her career post-marriage.

Taylor's triumphant return: Decoding the glamour of The Life of a Showgirl Taylor Swift's The Life of a Showgirl isn't just an album, it's a confession booth set to music. Here's a Gen Z-style deep dive into all 12 tracks.

The Baahubali Bible: Inside the massive guide, a glue that holds the franchise The Baahubali Bible is the foundation of the franchise's detailed universe. Producer Shobu Yarlagadda, in an exclusive interview with India Today, talked about the world building, the massive bible that governs the franchise.

Saif on Amrita Singh's influence on his life: It's a pity things didn't work out Saif Ali Khan reflected on Amrita Singh's pivotal role in his life and career. Despite their separation, they maintain a respectful and amicable relationship.

Priyanka Chopra writes Nick's name in Karwa Chauth mehndi, daughter Malti joins fun Priyanka Chopra has kick-started preparations for Karwa Chauth celebrations. The actor shared a picture of her mehndi with Nick's name on it.

Nayanthara completes 22 years in cinema, says movies healed her in gratitude note Actor Nayanthara celebrated 22 years in the film industry with an emotional note. She expressed gratitude to fans and the film industry for shaping her life and healing her.

Love's Ambition review: A compelling romance anchored by Zhao Lusi's charm 'Love's Ambition' review: 'Love's Ambition' is a fresh Chinese drama mixing romance with ambition and class struggles. Zhao Lusi's layered performance elevates the show despite some writing flaws.

Taylor Swift breaks Adele's record as Showgirl sells 3.5 million units in one week Taylor Swift's latest album, 'The Life of a Showgirl', sold a full 3.5 million copies in its first week of release, breaking the previous record held by Adele.

Kantara Chapter 1 box office Day 7: Film sees dip after Rs 300-crore haul in India Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' surpassed Rs 300 crore nett in India but saw a dip in collections on Day 7. The film's performance will be closely watched for its second weekend momentum and global earnings potential.

Deepika Padukone Abu Dhabi ad outrage: When 'my choice' becomes your problem Deepika Padukone's Abu Dhabi ad sparks controversy over her wearing an abaya. But is the outrage justified? Here's why the backlash is totally misplaced - and what it really says about choice, feminism, and cultural respect.
From K-pop idol to fashion show star: BTS' V is Paris' favourite Kim Taehyung aka BTS member V once again stole the spotlight at Paris Fashion Week with his impeccable style and magnetic presence.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 46: Abhishek takes over kitchen, Malti forms new gang The latest episode of 'Bigg Boss 19' saw Abhishek Bajaj taking over the kitchen duty after Neelam Giri backed out. Farrhana Bhatt, who is the captain, clashed with Neelam and Amaal Mallik over the matter. The episode also saw Malti Chahar forming a new group.

Travis Kelce celebrates Taylor Swift's The Life of a Showgirl: I'm a lucky man NFL star Travis Kelce expressed pride as pop star Taylor Swift's new album 'The Life of a Showgirl' took the Internet by storm. He denied being the main creative muse behind the album.

Mohit Suri says Karan Johar thanked, South directors called to praise Saiyaara Director Mohit Suri opened up about how the film industry reacted to Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda starrer 'Saiyaara' at FICCI Frames on Wednesday. Yash Raj Films CEO Akshaye Wadhwani, who was also present, shared why the lead pair maintained a low profile before the film's release.

Ekta admits bringing Kyunki... was damn scary, Smriti admits their bond changed Producer Ekta Kapoor spoke about the thrill and challenges associated with bringing 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' after 25 years at FICCI Frames on Wednesday. Actor Smriti Irani, on the other hand, reflected on how their bond has evolved over the years.

general news.headline: Coldrif cough syrup maker shut permanently over child deaths, owner arrestedAccording to the police, Ranganathan was arrested last night and will be taken to Madhya Pradesh's Chhindwara district - where most of the deaths have been reported - after securing transit remand. The arrest happened shortly after he was detained for questioning by the Madhya Pradesh Police.

Haryana cop drafted will, ignored wife's frantic calls day before suicideSenior Haryana IPS officer Y Puran Kumar, who shot himself dead at his home in Chandigarh, drafted a will and sent that along with the 9-page suicide note to his wife, senior IAS officer, Amneet P Kumar, the day before. The receipt caused her to panic, and she called him 15 times, but all went unanswered.

Trump racing for Nobel Peace Prize day before announcement, White House cheers onIn a well-timed tweet, the White House called Donald Trump "peace President" after Israel and Hamas agreed to the first phase of his Gaza plan, a day before the Nobel Peace Prize for 2025 – which the 79-year-old has been eyeing – was announced.

PM welcomes Trump's Gaza peace plan, praises Netanyahu's strong leadershipPrime Minister Narendra Modi welcomed the first phase of US President Donald Trump's 20-point Gaza peace plan and hoped that the release of hostages and increased humanitarian assistance would bring relief to the people of the war-torn Palestinian enclave.

Tussle at Tata, the 2016 sagaAn ongoing tussle within the Tata Group has made the Union government call its leadership in for a meeting. We revisit the last time intrigue gripped the highest ranks of the salt-to-aerospace conglomerate.

Master it before it masters you: Kalli Purie on AI disrupting newsroomsIndia Today vice chairperson Kalli Purie, speaking at FICCI Frames 2025, stressed that the right approach to AI was not to be fearful of new technology but to master it by jumping in feet first.

PM Modi, Keir Starmer meet in Mumbai; trade and tech ties in focus Live UpdatesThis is Prime Minister Keir Starmer's first official visit to India, following the signing of a significant trade agreement in July. He is being accompanied by the largest-ever UK trade delegation to India.

Why the global grip of Indian gangs is spelling fear for desi diaspora?Indian organised crime, led by the likes of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang, is escalating globally, with recent shootings in Surrey, Canada. Enhanced international cooperation, intelligence-sharing, and extradition agreements are vital to dismantling these syndicates, as they exploit diaspora networks and digital tools to orchestrate violence abroad.

Women are no longer ashamed of their greys, but what brought about this movement?Love your grey hair, but feel pressured to cover it? Remember, grey is beautiful too. So, own your natural grey with confidence and grace.

In stormy Vizag, India eye smooth sailing against upbeat South AfricaIndia vs South Africa, Women's World Cup: Unbeaten so far, hosts India will have to shake off their cautious approach in the coastal city of Vizag when they face a rejuvenated South Africa on Thursday, aiming to inject much-needed momentum into their sluggish ICC Women's World Cup campaign.

Producer Shobu Yarlagadda, in an exclusive interview with India Today, talked about the world building, the massive bible that governs the franchise.

He imagined those words: Chidambaram hits back at PM's 26/11 response barbCalling PM Modi's attack on him a figment of imagination, Chidambaram tweeted, "It is disappointing to read that the Hon'ble prime minister of India imagined the words and attributed them to me."

Deepika Padukone Abu Dhabi ad outrage: When 'my choice' becomes your problemDeepika Padukone's Abu Dhabi ad sparks controversy over her wearing an abaya. But is the outrage justified? Here's why the backlash is totally misplaced - and what it really says about choice, feminism, and cultural respect.
Gurgaon woman says cab driver texted her using UPI after tip, shares scary ordealOn the subreddit r/Gurgaon, a woman cautioned, "Girls, please think twice before being nice to cab drivers!"

Rift deepens among Yunus-led interim government allies in BangladeshTensions rise in Bangladesh's interim government as adviser Syeda Rizwana Hasan denies claims of a "safe exit." The dispute, rooted in the 2024 student-led uprising, flags cracks in Muhammad Yunus's government.

Lawyer who threw shoe at CJI Gavai expelled from Bar, can't enter Supreme CourtIn its notice announcing senior lawyer Rakesh Kishore's suspension, the Bar Association said,"Such reprehensible, disorderly, and intemperate behaviour is utterly unbecoming of an officer of the court and constitutes a serious breach of professional ethics, decorum, and the dignity of the Supreme Court."

Rare sight: Mount Everest visible from Bihar town thanks to clear skies, clean airLocated on the banks of the Kamla River, which originates from a glacier in Nepal along the India-Nepal border, Jaynagar is a culturally vibrant town where the world's highest peak appears directly in line on the map.

Gloomy, wet, chilly winter this year? Here's what experts sayMuch of northern India is facing its first signs of winter with heavy snowfall in the Himalayas and rain-laced chills across the Gangetic plains. Does that signal a potentially colder and wetter season ahead? While the IMD and the US Climate Prediction Centre predicted a 71% chance of a colder-than-average winter, experts caution that it's still too early to confirm the severity and duration of the 2025 winter.

Repair strained ties with India immediately: 21 US lawmakers write to TrumpIn a letter to President Trump, the US lawmakers said the recent increase in tariffs on Indian goods has damaged bilateral relations and hurt both American consumers and manufacturers.

How much can you earn if you invest iPhone 17 Pro EMIs in a 36-month SIP?If a buyer converts the iPhone 17 Pro's price into a 36-month EMI plan, it roughly comes to Rs 4,200 per month, which is a decent amount to invest in an SIP.

I am an orthopaedic doctor and this is how I care for my knees and bonesAn orthopaedic surgeon reveals his golden rules for maintaining joint health through balanced exercise and nutrition. Every extra kilo adds more stress to the knees.

Gmail vs Zoho Mail: What changes when you switch accountsWe have heard of Arattai. But the next app that is going viral now from Zoho is its Mail app. Many high-profile users are switching to it. Should you too and how it is different from Gmail? We explain.

Maharashtra says yes to co-ed. Is it time for India's schools to change?Maharashtra, one of India's biggest states, has just scrapped all-boys and all-girls schools,  pushing for co-education that mirrors real life. This may have opened the doors to an overall move towards co-ed, and a better hope towards gender equality in India. Here, we take a deeper look at how single-sex schooling began, its downsides for students today, and how co-ed classrooms can better prepare everyone for modern life.

Pregnant Delhi woman pours hot oil on sleeping husband, smears chilli as he screamsAccording to the survivor, he felt a burning sensation when hot oil was poured over his body and woke up to find his wife standing nearby with chilli powder, which she then threw on him. Dinesh claimed that his wife threatened to pour more oil if he raised an alarm.

Harry Potter: John Lithgow's look as Dumbledore from the HBO series leaked onlineProduction of the 'Harry Potter' reboot series started in July 2025 with limited official visuals. Early leaks of actor John Lithgow as Dumbledore have recently surfaced online.

Karan Johar chooses profit over passion after Homebound failure, calls it upsettingKaran Johar reflected on focusing on profitable cinema after selling 50 per cent of Dharma Productions. The filmmaker discussed challenges faced by critically acclaimed but unprofitable films like 'Homebound'. Johar confirmed the company's stability and continued control after the deal with Adar Poonawalla.

sports.headline: Harshit Rana arrives at Gautam Gambhir's team dinner in swanky BMW India fast bowler Harshit Rana arrived at Gautam Gambhir's dinner party in a swanky BMW. The Indian head coach hosted a team session ahead of the 2nd Test match vs West Indies.

Mitchell Starc returns to BBL after 11 years, set to play for Sydney Sixers Mitchell Starc is set to return to the Big Bash League after an 11-year hiatus, joining Sydney Sixers for BBL 15. His recent T20I retirement has opened the door for the pacer to focus on franchise cricket following the Ashes.

Gautam Gambhir snubbed: How to read Rohit Sharma's viral Champions Trophy tribute Rohit Sharma's Champions Trophy tribute to Rahul Dravid has raised eyebrows for one glaring omission: head coach Gautam Gambhir. While Dravid's influence on India's success is undeniable, the timing of Rohit's viral speech has only added fuel to the rumour mills.

Daniil Medvedev lashes out at referee in yet another on-court meltdown Russian tennis player Daniil Medvedev faced yet another on-court meltdown in the Shanghai Masters. Warned for service delays, Medvedev reacted sharply to umpire's code violation.

Alyssa Healy not dwelling on batting disaster ahead of crucial India game Australia nearly faced a massive disaster in Colombo against Pakistan. However, skipper Alyssa Healy remains unfazed ahead of their crucial India clash.

Barcelona heads to USA: LaLiga confirms first-ever outside Spain fixture LaLiga will stage its first-ever official league match outside Spain as Villarreal hosts Barcelona in Miami on December 20, 2025. The decision, approved by UEFA, represents a significant moment for European football but has sparked controversy regarding fan interests and tradition.

Smriti Mandhana's World Cup form not a big worry for India: Sushma Verma Veteran wicketkeeper Sushma Verma feels Smriti Mandhana's slow start in the Women's World Cup isn't alarming, as players like Jemimah Rodrigues and Harmanpreet Kaur can step up.

After India snub, Mohammed Shami set to make Ranji Trophy return for Bengal Fast bowler Mohammed Shami made his return to the Bengal Ranji side. Shami, was not picked for the white-ball tour of India.

IND vs WI: Captain Shubman Gill shares batting tips, gives throw-downs to Sai Sudharsan Ahead of the second Test against West Indies, India captain Shubman Gill was seen mentoring Sai Sudharsan during practice in Delhi. The young opener received batting tips and throw-downs as he looks to regain form.

Vizag weather report: Will rain ruin India's crucial group-stage game? India vs South Africa: Inclement weather in Vizag is set to threaten what promises to be an exciting encounter in Vizag. Will the match get washed out today?

Harshit Rana's selection questionable, but people shouldn't troll him: R AshwinRavichandran Ashwin has defended young fast bowler Harshit Rana amid criticism over his India selection and urged fans to avoid making personal attacks on the fast bowler.

Jemimah confident but India's misfiring top-order faces litmus test vs SAIndia may be unbeaten, but their much-vaunted top order has failed to fire against less-fancied opponents in the home Women's World Cup. While Jemimah Rodrigues has downplayed concerns around the top order, India must address these batting concerns quickly to avoid any costly slips.

Parking aside 2022 no-ball nightmare, India eye redemption heist against South AfricaBack in 2022, India's Women's World Cup campaign ended in heartbreak after a loss to South Africa in Christchurch. This time, they will be aiming for redemption on Thursday in Vizag.

Treat Rohit and Virat with respect and sensitivity, not doubt: Ashwin tells BCCIFormer India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin calls for greater respect and clearer communication for senior players Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. He emphasises the importance of handling leadership changes with sensitivity and ensuring knowledge transfer to younger cricketers.

IND vs WI: India confident Sudharsan can crack the Test code despite modest returnsIndia remains confident in Sai Sudharsan's Test potential despite early inconsistency. The team believes his domestic form and backing will help him succeed amid tough competition.

India to remain unchanged for Delhi Test, Nitish to get another go: Assistant coachIndia are set to field the same playing XI for the second Test against West Indies at Arun Jaitley Stadium. The team management aims to develop Nitish Kumar Reddy as a seam-bowling all-rounder by providing him more game time, revealed assistant coach Ryan Ten Doeschate.

South Africa over England collapse, confident ahead of India clash: Nadine de KlerkNadine de Klerk believes that South Africa have moved past their poor showing in the tournament-opener and fancy their chances of taking on the hosts, India on Thursday.

Tharun Mannepalli upsets Toma Junior Popov as Lakshya Sen suffers another early exitUnseeded Tharun Mannepalli produced a stunning comeback to defeat world No 14 Toma Popov at the Arctic Open. His victory keeps India's men's singles hopes alive amid other early exits by Indian shuttlers.

Going to back ourselves to keep Smriti Mandhana under pressure: Nadine de KlerkWomen's World Cup 2025: South Africa's Nadine de Klerk remains confident in the side's chances against the tournament-hosts India and will be backing themselves to come up with plans to take down Smriti Mandhana in their highly anticipated encounter.

Gill makes fashion statement as Team India arrive at Gambhir's dinner partyThe Indian men's cricket team arrived at head coach Gautam Gambhir's residence in Delhi for dinner ahead of the 2nd Test against the West Indies scheduled to be played at the Arun Jaitley Stadium from October 10–14.

Beth Mooney's rescue act powers Australia to dominant win against PakistanWomen's World Cup, AUS vs PAK: Australia hammered Pakistan by 107 runs on Wednesday, October 8 to reclaim the top spot in the table. Beth Mooney starred for them with a hundred while Kim Garth picked up three wickets.

Joe Root snaps back at Australian critics: This Ashes is not about meJoe Root, England's senior batter, has responded to the ongoing scrutiny about his absence of a Test hundred on Australian soil, saying that the upcoming Ashes is about the squad's performance, not his personal milestones.

Scary for opponents that we're winning without playing a perfect match: JemimahIndia batter Jemimah Rodrigues has said that it must be scary for opponents that they're winning despite not playing a perfect match in the tournament so far. The Women in Blue will next take on South Africa in their third fixture of the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 after beating Sri Lanka and Pakistan.

Jemimah Rodrigues addresses form concerns: Not thinking about individual scoresJemimah Rodrigues remains optimistic despite a slow start in the Women's World Cup 2025. The right-handed batter has registered scores of 0 and 32 in the two innings so far in the tournament.

Cristiano Ronaldo hits historic feat, becomes first billionaire footballer: ReportCristiano Ronaldo achieves billionaire status, setting new financial records with his latest Al-Nassr contract and joining a select group of athlete billionaires.

King makes Pakistan pay as Australia flaunt batting depthWomen's World Cup: Alana King's unbeaten 51 and a record 106-run stand with Beth Mooney rescued Australia from collapse to 221 for nine, showcasing their trademark batting depth against Pakistan in Colombo.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
